stealth.details: (master) to notice the subtle electrical and magical energies within the reactor gaining power.

details.disable: @Check[computers|dc:36] (expert) to override the device's programming and vent the unholy energy, @Check[arcana|dc:35] or @Check[religion|dc:35] to control or subvert the flow of the unholy energies building in the device, @Check[crafting|dc:34] or @Check[thievery|dc:34] to manually adjust the cables and divert power away from the reactor; six total successes are required to prevent the station's reactor from igniting the destruction of Kehtaria's sun.
details.description: A magitech device channels the flow of unholy magic throughout the reactor. This process is set to detonate and destroy Kehtaria's sun, leading to a stellar effect that could cascade along a nearby Drift lane to affect several stars.
details.reset: The trap deactivates once the PCs gain the requisite number of successes.
details.routine: (2 actions) The trap uses its first action to Vent Energy. It then uses its second action to attempt an overload. If the trap has any instability points, roll a flat check with a DC equal to 20 minus the number of instability points it has. On a success, the magitech device detonates, destroying the station and Kehtaria's sun and creating massive galactic repercussions (see Concluding the Adventure). The PCs on the station are irrevocably slain.

publication.title: Starfinder Second Edition Playtest Adventure: Empires Devoured

description.value:
Trigger A creature begins trying to stop the ritual, or 10 minutes after the atrocite is defeated

Effect Red lightning crackles within the reactor and consoles in the area. Creatures on the second or third levels of area B11 take @Damage[(2d10+10)[electricity]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:34|basic] save. On a critical failure, the target also takes an additional @Damage[2d10[void]] damage. The trap rolls initiative.

The modified engine releases its energy against those attempting to tamper with it. If there are no creatures in the area to take damage, then the power instead redirects fully into the engine, reducing the number of successes earned by 1. If there are no successes, the trap instead gains 1 instability point. Otherwise, creatures within the room take @Damage[(4d10+15)[void]] damage and must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:33] save. Creatures immune to void damage (such as undead) instead take acid damage. A creature slain by this hazard is reduced to a fine powder.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and an additional @Damage[2d10[electricity]] damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and an additional @Damage[4d10[electricity]] damage, and it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.
